attributes.action: Manchester & other pro-EU cities to become independent EU member city states
attributes.background:
Manchester, Liverpool, Leeds, London, etc... We didnt vote to leave the EU. We want to protections that EU membership offers in terms of workers rights, human rights, and environmental legislation. 
We want to secede from the UK & remain in the EU, operating as a network of independent city states.
attributes.additional_details:
The cities that voted to remain in the EU have a long history of welcoming migrants and of fighting for progressive values. We want to continue to enjoy the benefits of EU membership whilst also fighting for a better Europe. 

With devolution already on the agenda, our cities could operate as networked city-states with EU membership. We should hold local referenda on seceding from the UK and remaining in the EU.

attributes.action: Implement 3 month cooling off period for the EU referendum
attributes.background: We call upon the UK Government and Opposition parties to implement a cooling off period for the EU referendum so that a second ballot is required 3 months from now to verify the publics intent to leave once they have understood some of the actual implications of the UK leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details: There were many claims and counter claims made during the EU referendum and a heated and heady level of debate. The decision is a crucial one for our country and can't be taken lightly. Over the coming 3 months more data and evidence of the implications (positive and negative) will become clearer as discussions are had and ideas explored. The decision is so momentous that we believe the public should be asked to confirm their decision to leave after a 3 month cooling off period.

attributes.action: Remove EU flags from public buildings immediately because of the EU result.
attributes.background: We, the people of the UK, have decided to remove ourselves from the European Union via a referendum. We now demand the removal of the symbol of the EU, namely their flag, to be removed from all public buildings with immediate effect.

attributes.action: To require a two-thirds majority vote for all referendums in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
A referendum on a national level is meant to be a means for parliament to secure popular consent on issues that leave government divided, or when there is special need for a vote of public support.

This cannot be done when important constitutional changes are decided with a 1-5% majority.
attributes.additional_details:
With turnout in referendums generally falling, the UK needs to adapt it's rules according to voting so that two-thirds majority is required. The UK needs to factor in the fact that turnout will never be 100%, and that 51% of anything less than that is not an actual majority.

A two-thirds majority vote would secure popular consent on every level referendums are held, ensuring that government would have a genuine majority to grant the decision legitimacy regardless of voter turnout.

attributes.action: Raise awareness for Seat Back Failure, putting your children's lives at risk.
attributes.background: During a rear impact crash our front seats fully reclined with force, we have been informed this is standard from 'cheap' cars- ours was a 2014 model.  This happens with all makes and models potentially putting passenger's lives at risk. This Is unacceptable and higher standards are needed.
attributes.additional_details: Our mechanic informed us it is expected from cheaper cars as they use low quality seats, more expensive makes use higher quality. We believe there should be a standard of seats used, we are told to put our children in the back of our cars- unbeknownst to us potentially putting their lives at risk should they be in a crash! The front seats fly back at force, along with the person in them and the passengers in the back are flung forward- it's so very very dangerous.

attributes.action: Give citizens of the UK the ability to initiate their own nation-wide referenda.
attributes.background: After an appropriate sized petition is raised, of maybe 400,000 people, a nation-wide referendum is called to annul any act of parliament, law or treaty in effect within the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The word democracy stems from the Greek word, dēmokratía, comprising two parts: dêmos "people" and kratos "power". Without a demos, there is no democracy. But people without power is not democracy either.

Our current system of government is known as "representative democracy". That phrase is a misuse of the word democracy. People do not hold power: that system cannot by definition be a democracy.

attributes.action: Guns and knives are to injure or kill, fixed 15 year sentence for possession!
attributes.background: Gun & Knife crime is drastically rising. All that are from an area where this is relevant know full well it is because the youth today have no fear or comprehension of consequences. This needs to change! Knowing you will serve 15 years with no half serving, no good behaviour is the place to start.
attributes.additional_details:
With the restrictions put on parenting, the amount of power children & teenagers are allowed to have on how they are educated, raised and dealt with, have all led to a carefree, lack of respect attitude with no understanding of cause & effect. Introducing a fixed/minimum sentencing of 15 years for possession of a gun/knife/weapon to injure or kill would really make a difference.

I know full well that me and anyone I grew up with who carried would never have done so had this been the case.

attributes.action: Increase preschool and nursery funding entitlements.
attributes.background: Nurseries and Preschools are coming under increasing financial pressure due to the low amount paid by the government for the funded places for 2,3 and 4 year olds, coupled with increased costs due to rises in the National Living Wage and Pension rule changes.  A full review of the funding is needed.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount currently paid for a preschool funded place is far lower than the actual cost of providing the care, especially with other government changes meaning their costs have gone up significantly and will do again if the NLW rises as planned to £9 per hour, and with the introduction of 30 hours free childcare places from 2017.

We would urge the government to carry out a full review of the amounts paid to ensure the continuation of our much needed preschools.

attributes.action: Make Southeastern performance data public to confirm 'tough targets' enforcement
attributes.background:
In Sep 2014, Southeastern were awarded 4 more years & we were promised 'tough targets'/'transparency' by Rail Minister Claire Perry
We call on MP Perry to lift the restriction on sharing target results under FOI so rail users can see the results vs targets

Full info at http://serailaction.uk
attributes.additional_details:
Southeastern Railway Action Group filed an FOI request to see performance data submitted by Southeastern to see how they performed against the "tough targets"

The Department for Transport denied this under commercial & public interest reasons.

Full details at: http://serailaction.uk/2016-03-25-Southeastern-performance-FOI-response.html

Since the DfT/MP Perry assured us that "tough targets" would be in place, while rail users see a constant decline we want to see this data & what has been done

attributes.action: Decriminalise None Payment Of The BBC's Television Licence (TV Licence)
attributes.background: The BBC are backed by the UK Government to criminalise non payers of the TV licence. It currently costs £145 a year for a colour licence. The people of the UK shouldn't be forced into paying a company that sort of money. Let's call on the government to decriminalise non payment of the TV licence!
attributes.additional_details: We are in the age of cuts, cuts & more cuts and the citizens of the UK simply do not have £145 available. The BBC have already scrapped BBC THREE and now we are getting even less for our money. So help us help you by signing this petition to decriminalise nonpayment of the BBC's TV licence. ABOLISH THE TV LICENCE TAX!

attributes.action: Make conjugal visits legal in the UK
attributes.background: Conjucal visits in the uk could help inmates As there wouldn't be so much tension In the prison, it would relieve frustration which would make it a calmer environment. Also give the inmates something to work towards. Also partners on the outside suffer being away from there loved ones.

attributes.action: Stop all terrier work
attributes.background: Terrier-work is the most cruel part of fox hunting. It causes fear, pain and distress to foxes being dug/flushed out and killed.
attributes.additional_details: As a campaigner I have witnessed both legal and illegal terrier work. Both are cruel because there is fine line between legal and illegal. Terrier work is underground hunting. Since foxes do not live naturally underground - they only enter a sett or earth to escape danger or give birth. Foxes are reluctant to defend themselves when cornered but will fight to defend their cubs - this can also cause serious injury to the entered terrier. Banning all terrier work is the only civilised option.

attributes.action: Scrap Prime Minister's Questions
attributes.background: Since it seems that neither the Prime Minister nor the vast majority of MPs are able to take PMQs seriously, it is clearly a waste of time and should either be replaced or scrapped.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-35651000

attributes.action: Make it illegal for anyone to use images of service men without consent
attributes.background:
When I talk about using images of service men I am including those that have also left the force. 
This has come around after seeing countless upon countless photos of Lee Rigby (RIP) be used without permission from his family causing them distress and they can't do anything about it
attributes.additional_details: As of writing this far right group Britain First have continued to disrespect the memory of Lee Rigby, as such caused the family of said person distress and grief, amongst this people have used other service men and ex service men's images without permission from the person or family, mainly from the family due to the fact that they use deceased members as there logic is "there not alive to stop us so were going to do it" most of the time disrespecting there memory.

attributes.action: Automatic joint custody in family law courts unless evidence to deny one party
attributes.background:
Will prevent one party having 'power' over another.
Well evidenced that both parents are equally as important in a child's life.
Will promote co-parenting and child will see both parents sharing decision making. Better decisions will be made for the child if pros and cons have to be discussed

attributes.action: For services signed up to online, legally require the ability to cancel online
attributes.background:
Services such as utilities and telecoms have benefited significantly by encouraging customers to sign up online.

Conversely it is made increasingly more difficult to cancel. Providers often only offer a telephone call with a long wait and use strong sales techniques to change a customer's mind.

attributes.action: Whole of life sentences for terrorist acts, multiple, child and sex murders.
attributes.background: We the British public would like changes made to the judicial system which would mean that the most serious of crimes including, children being abused and killed, sexually motivated murders, multiple murders and terrorist acts be punishable with whole of life sentences without the chance of parole
attributes.additional_details: I like so many other members of the British public are appalled and deeply saddened by the almost daily atrocities that are happening on the streets of Britain. It just might be deterrent enough that a whole of life sentence reduces these most serious of crimes, but for those that do commit such vile acts should know that when they are caught they will serve the rest of their days in prison so that the public can live their lives with a little less to fear. Some criminals should be punished and not rehabilitated

attributes.action: Ensure disabled people are not treated less favourably when winning sport events
attributes.background: The equalities aft is clear there should be no discrimination against people who have a disability ..prise money should be equal to all people irrespective of whether they are disabled or not ..

attributes.action: All British expats in EU should have the Right To Vote in a Second Referendum
attributes.background: It is not democratic to vote on whether to leave or stay in the EU if British Citizens living in EU countries for longer than 15 years do not have the right to vote. We still have British Citizenship and Passports, and therefore should not be excluded.

attributes.action: Hold a UK referendum on the future of the union between Scotland and England.
attributes.background: Now the result of the EU referendum is known, the Scottish Government considers the prospect of a second Scottish independence referendum 'on the table'. A National referendum would allow for the will of the entire electorate to be known on the future of the Union formed in 1707.
attributes.additional_details: Some are calling, as in 2014, for the rest of the UK to have a voice in the question of Scottish independance. Many Scots, resident elsewhere in the UK or even Expats who were eligible to vote in the EU referendum, were not eligible for the 2014 independence referendum.

attributes.action: Allow children to vote after passing quiz which proves understanding of politics
attributes.background: We believe that children should have the right to vote if they can demonstrate their understanding and interest in politics by passing a quiz. We think it is unfair that citizens are given the right to vote solely based on their age, when some children have a better understanding than some adults.
attributes.additional_details: Children will have to live with the ramifications of political decisions longer than any of the voting population. Some, not all, children are very passionate about current issues and have relevant ideas and perspectives to share. We believe it would be irresponsible to allow all children the vote, as many have little to no understanding or appreciation of politics. However, we argue that age is not a fair classification in determining one's right to create change.

attributes.action: Ban children under the age of 12 being sold sugary or high sugar content drinks
attributes.background:
Sugary drinks are proven to cause numerous health issues and have a high risk factor to health. Children should not be able to buy sugary drinks and should only be purchased with a parent or adult.
Children are not educated on health and this may promote healthy living through a ban.
attributes.additional_details:
The government do not do enough to educate children to the risk factors or unhealthy food and drink choices. Sugary drinks are the leading contributing factors to poor health in children and adults. 
Sugary drinks cause many health issues such as, Cancers, Diabetes, heart disease, dental issues, mood swings, hormonal imbalances, high blood pressure, acne, skin conditions and being obese or overweight.

attributes.action: Reduce Animal testing and put harsher rules in place when testing on animals
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of animal testing but I believe without it we wouldn't have the scientific knowledge that we have now. I would like the government to put harsher rules on animal testing and also for companies to have to display that they test on animals on the labels of their products.
attributes.additional_details:
A little more information... Some of the rules that I believe should be put in place:

-Any animal that is tested on should immediately be released and   
given the best quality of life possible or be put down. They should also be given freedom while being tested on.
-Any company that tests on animals should be forced to make a 
minimum donation to charities that support any animal wellbeing. 
-Any company or brand that tests on animals must display this on their packaging in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for people to smoke while in charge of a motor vehicle.
attributes.background: Using a mobile phone behind the wheel in the UK is banned because it's distracting and causes accidents, so why isn't smoking behind the wheel illegal too. It's dangerous for drivers as only one hand is likely to be present, but also distracting to roll, find and light a cigarette.
attributes.additional_details: Attention is key while driving and smoking distracts you fully from the road. It should not be allowed to promote safety in cars and also healthier living in the population.

attributes.action: Get the government to invest more money in mental health to lower waiting times.
attributes.background: Currently the wait to receive mental health treatment for mental illness is approximately 56 weeks (or more), without interim support, where people are now in & out of the crisis team at A&E more & more. Funding needs to increase & the waiting times need to come down before people turn to suicide!
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people at some time in their life will be diagnosed with a mental health issue. However, 75% of those 1 in 4 will be left in the system for over a year to struggle on their own without access to interim support.

http://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/statistics-and-facts-about-mental-health/how-common-are-mental-health-problems/

attributes.action: Allow aged relatives outside the EU border to enter the UK via Visa application.
attributes.background: My Mother, 65, is currently living in Asia dependent on previous savings, and is unable to look after herself. Moreover, there is no one to take care of her as no close relations live with her; she is on her own. After admitting several Visa applications, the final reply was NO.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to invite my Mother so that I can take care of her personally in her late years. Furthermore, I want her to enhance the cultural views in the household and to provide that cultural upbringing to my children.

Sign this petition to take a further step onto battling such visa refusals that have no right of appeal; making the Human Right Act a mere privilege.

attributes.action: Enforce minimum wage calculation to be changed to help commission based workers.
attributes.background: For many years now National Minimum wage has been calculated and includes commission based jobs, so to calculate how your minimum wage is made up, your commissions will be topping your salary up to make up the short fall, this in some commissioned based jobs can be a short fall of £600 or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The National Minimum wage and the new National Living wage keeps getting increased and the government are leaving commissions in the calculations so the short fall is increasing.
Employers are abusing the loop hole by not paying national minimum wage and relying on their employees to make up the short fall with commissions.
THE SOLUTION
There should at least be a National Minimum Salary enforced to overcome this, this should equate to the amount of hours you work at the National Minimum wage.

attributes.action: Make it so someone working 40 hours on minimum wage dont pay tax on earnings
attributes.background: I believe that if the government is saying that a person needs to earn a set amount every hour to survive it is then wrong of them to take money off you in taxes from your earnings.
attributes.additional_details:
I think that if someone was earning minimum wage at £7.20 an hour and worked 39 hours a week for a full 52 weeks they would earn £14601.60
I believe that as a government you should make it into law that you can not be taxed on your earnings if you earn less then the minimum wage yearly total.

attributes.action: Leave Corporation Tax at 20% and use the extra £6.5b to help our most vulnerable
attributes.background:
As a business owner I'm happy to pay Corporation Tax to make society fairer.
The most vulnerable people in our society are being left desperate.
I'm fortunate to be able to survive on my income. There are many in our country who now can't survive.
As a business owner I'm in a position to help.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving Corporation Tax at 20% could reinstate Disability Welfare reductions, and remove the need for sanctioning people. People are being forced into homelessness and are actually dying because they're being sanctioned by ATOS. Their appeal hearings are taking months. 50% of appeals are won but, until they are, people are left without money to survive. 
I don't want to live in a society that is happy to let this happen so would like it changed. I'm happy to fund helping those that need it.

attributes.action: Limmit the maximum amout of rent charges to "council tax*(3+number of bedroom)"
attributes.background:
The current rent prices have gone out of control.

Housing benefit is often not covering the cost of renting even a room. In some rent has gone up from £300 - £400 4 years ago to nearly £1000 p/m. Increasingly, people can afford to stay in a place unless they share a room with another tenant.
attributes.additional_details:
I suggest to make maximum rent equal to
Property Council Tax * (3 + Number of bedrooms)

For example
This way the cheapest 1 bed property in band A max rent will be around
£100 tax * (3 + 1 bedroom) = £400
A bigger property in a higher band will provide higher yield to cover the increased number of people living there, like with 2 bedrooms
£150 (band 2 tax) * (3 + 2 bedrooms) = £750

Limiting only top prices will allow for the market to separate properties further by their value.

attributes.action: Introduce Apprenticeship's for 30-40 year olds
attributes.background: For 10 years,people born between 1976 &1982 have not been eligible to gain better training for their futures. The "Credit Crunch" forced thousands of workers into unemployment. As an "unskilled worker",an apprenticeship would give work vision and hope for those people who have lost it.

attributes.action: All plastic packaging produced by supermarkets must be made to be recyclable
attributes.background: There is an inordinate amount of plastic produced by supermarkets.  At least 50% of this shows that it is not recyclable. So much plastic is being put into bins and then into landfill. Individuals are responsible for recycling but given the opportunity to recycle more I think most will.

attributes.action: Reinstate the 2006 plan for all new homes built after 2016 to be zero carbon.
attributes.background: The plan would have ensured that all new dwellings from 2016 would generate as much energy on-site – via renewable sources, e.g. wind or solar energy – as they would use in heating, hot water, lighting and ventilation. This would be alongside tighter energy efficiency standards.
attributes.additional_details:
Zero Carbon homes are not more expensive - designers at Cardiff University built a zero carbon house at no extra cost here: (http://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-33544831). Also, they will be cheaper to run as energy costs could be zero or even negative, therefore earning the owners money.
As well as the economic benefits of zero carbon homes, reducing carbon emissions is also important for climate change; and reducing energy dependency on other countries (i.e. by importing gas and oil)

attributes.action: Prior to invoking Article 50 UK Gov should renegotiate EU reform & hold 2nd Ref
attributes.background: The UK Gov to work alongside EU Gov's & the EU Comm to Reform EU Treaties prior to invoking Article 50 and then put a second IN/OUT Referendum to the UK electorate on the basis of delivering material change since the 1st Referendum. This is the pragmatic way forward and will keep the Union intact.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that the UK OUT vote has sent shock waves across Europe and that the Euro Politicians are now coming to terms that they will need to be open to renegotiation and reform whereas previously they were complacent & intransient particularly as they face similar Eurosceptism and calls for similar IN/OUT referendums from their own electorate as things stand. It is time for Europe to reform and it is time for the UK to lead these discussions now that the European elite are in listening mode.

attributes.action: The UK should not leave the EU until all devolved assemblies of the UK agree.
attributes.background: The non-binding EU referendum has shown a simple majority for the 'leave the EU' option. However the results represent the majority view of the English and Welsh but not of voters in Scotland, Northern Ireland and London. It would undemocractic to force this result on the UK as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: The vote has not produced a clear mandate from the whole of the United Kingdom. There is now a very real risk of the UK disintegrating if this vote is simply seen as a mandate to remove the UK from the EU. The Government may accept the the result as advisory, but should now discuss will all devolved assemblies and with the EU as to a means of obtaining a compromise on the views expressed by this divided nation.

attributes.action: Re-introduce TIER 1 General VISA or Lift restrictions on TIER 2 VISA
attributes.background: Re-introduce TIER 1 General VISA or Lift restrictions on TIER 2 VISA as it is impacting so many of IT Professionals lives who strongly wish to live and work in UK.
attributes.additional_details: There are number of IT professionals who has taken their education and started working in UK struggling a lot due to the restrictions on TIER 2 General VISA. So taking all the problems into consideration kindly re-introduce TIER 1 General VISA or Lift restrictions on TIER 2 VISA as it is impacting so many of IT Professionals lives who strongly wish to live and work in UK.

attributes.action: Ensure political advertising carries an ASA disclaimer
attributes.background: Unlike any other advertising, political advertising is exempt from the remit of the Advertising Standards Authority. The public expects all adverts to be legal, decent and truthful, including political adverts.  All political advertising should carry a disclaimer about exemption from ASA standards.

attributes.action: Do not invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty for five years
attributes.background: While acknowledging that Britain has voted by national referendum to leave the European Union, we the undersigned urge HM Government to withhold from invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty for a period of five years from the date of the referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This will provide the best framework for a well-managed British withdrawal from the European Union, promoting national unity, enabling fair and amicable negotiations, and preventing long term damage to the British economy.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens living in the EU a vote concerning UK membership of it.
attributes.background: We, the long-term British residents of EU countries, will shortly lose our status as EU citizens, seriously compromising our continued stay in our host countries.  We have had no say in the referendum process, having lost the right to vote. We ask as UK citizens to add our votes to the referendum.

attributes.action: UK must reaffirm its commitment of sovereignty over Gibraltar after Brexit
attributes.background: With Spain renewing its claim of sovereignty over Gibraltar in a matter hours after the UK voted to leave the European Union, the UK Government must immediately reaffirm its commitment to Gibraltar .
attributes.additional_details:
The UK must a make a binding treaty with the European Union guaranteeing Gibraltar special status, which guarantees visa free cross-border movement for people and trade between Gibraltar and Spain. 

The UK government must grant Gibraltar their own dedicated MP in parliament 

The UK must re-establish our permanent Army and Royal Navy bases on Gibraltar to guarantee its future security.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in front of children, or in rooms which they use
attributes.background: Adults who smoke in front of children, especially inside a house are neglecting the health of that child. Smoke also hangs around on furniture / walls / curtains, making it an unhealthy environment for the child. Smoking in front of a child should be illegal and deemed as child neglect

attributes.action: Create the Dog Licence Act 2016
attributes.background:
We British public love our dogs so creating a Dog Licence Act 2016 would create a system which would support policing of dog owners and create a welfare fund for shelters.

To make a legal requirment for all dog owners to have Insurance, Microchipping, Vet Registration and a Dog Licence.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Population of Dogs is 8.5m fact from RSPCA 2015.

If we charge a fee of £10 per month per Dog Licence of any breed or £120 per year, this would create just over 1 Billion pounds of which the money should be split between the Police for enforcing also administrating and the Animal Shelters to look after dogs in need.

To own a dog the licence criteria must be meet, the dog must be insured, microchipped and registered with a vet, the licence will hold all this information.

attributes.action: Provide Funding To Re-generate & re-open the Sankey Canal and its Locks
attributes.background: The sankey canal has long fell into disrepair, I put it to Rt Hon David Cameron PM & the government to provide additional funding to canals & river trust and st helens local authority to regenerate the first modern canal in england and also of the industrial age.
attributes.additional_details: The Sankey Canal was originally known as the Sankey Brook Navigation and later as the St Helens Canal. It lays claim to being the first modern canal in England, or the first canal of the industrial age, and indeed it opened before its more famous neighbour, the Bridgewater Canal.

attributes.action: Regulate Service Charges for flats/houses leaseholders and freeholders
attributes.background:
House Association can't produce real motivations and explain the increase of Service Charge they managing.
H.A.'s decide unilaterally without involving resident in any decision. For this reason the amount of S.C. asked is not justified and unfair against the tenants which we are not rich.
attributes.additional_details:
1) Resident don't get involved in any decisions. 
2) Enormous increase (double) in less than 5 years? How is it possible? Nothing increased that much services/salaries. 
3) Lack of transparency
4) The property has a number of anomalies some of these are dangerous or create logistical inconvenience to residents
5) competent action against the cooperative to verify why those houses built with public money, a year after its construction they appear with serious defects.

attributes.action: The UK should remove the moderator (silencer) licensing requirement for firearms
attributes.background: Moderators (silencers/suppressors) are designed to reduce the volume of a gunshot. Modern shooters & those around them deserve the best in hearing protection, and moderators can help provide this. They should be treated as a safety measure, without the need for expensive FAC variation.
attributes.additional_details:
In many countries throughout the world, moderators are treated as devices to protect the hearing of shooters and those around them.

Removing the requirement for a moderator to be held on a Firearms Certificate would help shooters to further protect their hearing, and would reduce the effect the sound of shooting has on other people & the environment. Furthermore, it would also help reduce police workload as police would no longer have to process certificate variations for moderators.

attributes.action: Abandon the plan to increase the standard school day to eight hours long.
attributes.background: George Osborne recently announced his plan to help increase a standard school day to being eight hours long. This is simply ludicrous. As a current student, I can say that the additional time will not be useful. Students want to spend as little time in school as possible. This is not what we want.
attributes.additional_details:
Towards the end of a school day as it is, there is a lack of concentration from students.

The Chancellor says that his plan is to enable us to have the best future possible. He's wrong. The longer the school day, the more problems there are.There will be more reports of bullying, leading to lower grades, stress, anxiety, depression, and even suicide.

attributes.action: Stop Scottish MPs voting against bills for England that are enacted in Scotland
attributes.background: SNP voting against the Sunday Trading Hours Bill for England and Wales was wrong and selfish, as Scotland has more lax trading hours on Sundays so it is unfair that Scottish MPs vote against something to be enacted in England that is already enacted in Scotland.

attributes.action: David Cameron to honour his promise that Shipbuilding would remain in Portsmouth
attributes.background:
THE government is accused of abandoning Portsmouth after ministers failed to answer what action it would take to bring back shipbuilding to the city.

Yesterday saw the collapse of a crucial deal between the Ministry of Defence (MoD) and Magma Structures that would have restored Shipbuilding.
attributes.additional_details:
Likewise, the minister for Portsmouth, Mark Francois, failed to answer the questions sent to him yesterday, instead hailing the move to convert the shiphall into an engineering centre of excellence as ‘exciting’.

Now one of the nation’s biggest trade unions has urged the Tory chief to listen to the city and lay out his plans for the future.

Gary Cook, GMB regional organiser said: ‘It’s absolutely appalling. He (David Cameron) should be ashamed of himself.

attributes.action: Reverse changes to Spousal Visa requirements made in 2012
attributes.background: Prior to 2012 pension funds etc were taken into account to prove financial viability for non-eu spouses to travel to the UK with their returning British Citizen spouses. Also re-instate the ability of High Commissions to approve applications on individual merit, also removed in 2012.
attributes.additional_details: One may have the required GBP62,500+ in a pension fund, but unless the funds are in a current account for 6 months they do not count. This is unfair and prejudicial as to access those funds one has to resign and be jobless whilst waiting for the 6 month period. To force the British spouse to return alone to the UK to satisfy other requirements, for a period of up to 1 year is surely against the Human Right to a Family Life especially if ones child or children are already living there.

attributes.action: Introduce national statutory measures to shelter and rehabilitate rough sleepers
attributes.background:
Britain's cities are in the grip of a homelessness epidemic. Rough sleeping is hugely on the increase, and it's dangerous and degrading for those who have to do it. It is shameful for our society.
We ask government for urgent national statutory measures to shelter and rehabilitate rough sleepers.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics show a 55% increase in rough sleeping between 2010 and 2014. Independent statistics put the figure much higher, and the number has almost certainly risen substantially again since 2014. Most of these people are not eligible for help from statutory services in their current form. There is evidence to suggest that other government policies, such as short-sighted housing policy, cuts to social care budgets, and benefit-sanctioning, have swelled the numbers of homeless.
